definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
ardent/intense/fierce/stern/upright/to give one's life for a noble cause/exploits/achievements

sentences.english: I was gratified at the attendance to my talk, and the enthusiastic response.
sentences.chinese: 聽衆對我的發言予以熱烈的響應，令我深感榮幸。

sentences.english: A burst of hand-clapping followed the end of the song.
sentences.chinese: 歌聲結束後是一陣熱烈的掌聲。

sentences.english: This performance was a success and he was greeted by enthusiastic applause.
sentences.chinese: 這場音樂會相當成功，馬友友被報以熱烈的掌聲。

sentences.english: Young couple be smooching all over campus after finishing finals.
sentences.chinese: 期末考結束後，年輕愛侶在校園各處熱烈擁吻。

sentences.english: The job attributed to basophils that has spurred the most discussion is presenting antigens.
sentences.chinese: 嗜鹼性細胞抗原呈遞的新功能激起了最爲熱烈的討論。

sentences.english: Shocking the mathematical circles, it also arouses far-fLung and fervency interest all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 震撼數學界的歷史事件引起世界各界廣泛熱烈關注。

sentences.english: But none of us are fully on fire with love.
sentences.chinese: 但是我們都沒有如此熱烈的渴望愛。

sentences.english: The movie star was warmly cheered as he got on the stage.
sentences.chinese: 這位影星登上舞臺時受到人們的熱烈歡呼。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, all these can be make one feel gentle and kind but not bustling.
sentences.chinese: 但是這樣也會給人一種溫吞的感覺，彷彿不夠熱烈。

sentences.english: The "Sunshine Sports"program is warmly welcomed in our school.
sentences.chinese: “陽光體育運動”項目是在我們學校的熱烈歡迎。

sentences.english: Ghannouchi warmly welcomed Jiang's visit on behalf of the Tunisian government.
sentences.chinese: 加努希代表突尼斯政府對江主席的來訪表示熱烈歡迎。

sentences.english: Enthusiastic cheers expressed their appreciation of the performance.
sentences.chinese: 熱烈的喝采表達了他們對演出的讚賞。

sentences.english: The rebels defiantly welcomed new allies and laid plans for unionization campaigns.
sentences.chinese: 造反派熱烈歡迎新盟友，並制訂組織工會的計劃。

sentences.english: Please add my warmest congratulations to the large chorus of friends acclaiming your graduation.
sentences.chinese: 請將我最熱烈的祝賀收進朋友們的畢業讚歌。

sentences.english: When he arrived at Ashkalon, the citizens welcomed him with pomp .
sentences.chinese: 他來到阿市刻隆時，城裏的居民都熱烈地歡迎他。

sentences.english: Love that matures through hardships is the most passionate love.
sentences.chinese: 歷盡艱辛而成熟的愛情是最熱烈的愛情。

definition: the scene (of a crime, accident etc)/(on) the spot/(at) the site
to be present/to be on the scene
to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
(of an area) vast or extensive/large-scale/widespread/(of people) numerous
auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
